class.name: StorelessUnivariateStatistic

javadoc.text:
Extends the definition of {@link UnivariateStatistic} with{@link #increment} and {@link #incrementAll(double[])} methods for adding * values and updating internal state. *

* This interface is designed to be used for calculating statistics that can be * computed in one pass through the data without storing the full array of * sample values.
Updates the internal state of the statistic to reflect the addition of the new value.
Updates the internal state of the statistic to reflect addition of * all values in the values array. Does not clear the statistic first -- * i.e., the values are added incrementally to the dataset.
javadoc.param: values array holding the new values to add
javadoc.throws: MathIllegalArgumentException if the array is null

javadoc.text: Updates the internal state of the statistic to reflect addition of * the values in the designated portion of the values array. Does not * clear the statistic first -- i.e., the values are added * incrementally to the dataset.
javadoc.param: values array holding the new values to add
start the array index of the first value to add
length the number of elements to add
javadoc.throws: MathIllegalArgumentException if the array is null or the index

javadoc.text: Returns the current value of the Statistic.
javadoc.return: value of the statistic, Double.NaN if it * has been cleared or just instantiated.

javadoc.text: Returns the number of values that have been added.
Clears the internal state of the Statistic
Returns a copy of the statistic with the same internal state.
